general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Welcomed the new Commissioner Chakarian and encouraged him to introduce himself and share his interest in sustainability.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Chakarian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed pleasure at joining the committee.  Mentioned his background as a former engineer and current attorney in intellectual property. He has experience with inventions and technologies related to alternative fuels and sustainability, and aims to make the world more sustainable and environmentally friendly. He is a Glendale resident for over 10 years and is excited to help the city move forward in its goals towards greater sustainability, clean air, water, and overall improve the livability of Glendale.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about the process for submitting comment letters, referencing a letter introduced by former Commissioner Aleck at a prior meeting, inquiring if a draft is brought in, or the topic is on the agenda.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed the letter regarding drive-throughs was submitted to the City Manager and provided to council.  Also, confirmed that a new letter should be added as an agenda item.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Requested to add a letter regarding outreach to the community, including speaker series and field trips, and would bring a draft letter to the next meeting.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated he would find out if city council permission is needed to act and will bring recommendations to the next meeting.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Seconded adding this topic to the agenda.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Noted that the State of California officially announced a ban on Styrofoam or expanded polystyrene (EPS) food ware, even though SB 54 has been kicked back to the starting line. She noted that there are stores selling the product in Glendale and they should not be.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Acknowledged the EPS ban is effective immediately.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Clarified EPS refers to expanded polystyrene foam.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Commended the commissioners and city staff for their continued work on sustainability efforts despite current headwinds.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Wished former Sustainability Commissioner Aleck Barrosoff good luck on the Transportation Commission, noting that he was one of the original commissioners, along with Pinkerton, Kartunian, and herself.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Stated they hope Aleck will come and speak as needed and that the commission would value his input from the audience.

agenda_items.title: On-Site Report Regarding Posting of the Agenda
agenda_items.summary: The agenda for the May 1, 2025 meeting was posted on April 25, 2025, on the bulletin board outside City Hall.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
commissioner_comments.comment: Moved to approve the minutes.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Chakarian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated he reviewed the minutes and approves.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired if the tape of the meeting was reviewed.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Chakarian
commissioner_comments.comment: Acknowledged that he did not watch the video.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Recommended abstaining from the vote if the video was not watched.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: Announced a clothing swap that will be held in about two weeks in the Glendale Central Library Teen Center, and is being promoted through social media.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated they will get into more about Earth Day at a later agenda item. The Earth Day event was another part of the student commissioner projects and has now passed.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: The teen audience will allow them to learn more about sustainable practices through a more accessible way, through clothing. Since it is prom season, this will allow teens to swap formal wear and look for dresses at the library.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Noted a student commissioner proposal to educate against fast fashion, offering tailoring for items and a photo booth for prom-themed photos. A makeup artist would provide consultations, and goody bags donated by businesses will be distributed.

agenda_items.title: Oral Communication
agenda_items.summary: Comments from the public. Discussion is limited to items within the jurisdiction of the Sustainability Commission. Each speaker is allowed 5 minutes. Sustainability Commission members may question or respond to the speaker, but there will be no debate or decision. The matter may be referred to staff for investigation and report. There were no callers, but a card was submitted.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked Mr. Dish about the location of the tree cuttings.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed the tree removal happened at a Glendale Garden apartments, at North Central, and the project has been underway for 2 years.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: The city tried to get protections for privately owned trees, but did not get anywhere with the City Council.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
commissioner_comments.comment: Requested actual language pertaining to tree protections in the city charter.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: The current tree preservation ordinance applies to indigenous trees such as the bay laurel, California sycamore, and California oak trees. Trees on private property outside of those are not currently regulated.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated it's not just indigenous but also large trees that need to be protected.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
commissioner_comments.comment: Agreed with Vice-Chair Kartunian as he supports Legacy Tree efforts. Noted people's right to develop their property needs to be factored in.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Suggested reviewing the policies Pasadena has implemented as something that goes far beyond what Glendale does.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
commissioner_comments.comment: Moved to consider adopting what Pasadena has in place.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed a new agenda item needs to be added.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
commissioner_comments.comment: If a request to agendize the topic is supported by another member, it will be considered for the future.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Seconds the motion to agendize.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed high fire hazard concerns related to property with the developer being able to remove the tree.

agenda_items.title: A. Selection of Sustainability Commission Chairperson and Vice-Chairperson for the 2025-2026 Term.
agenda_items.summary: 1. Motion to elect the Chairperson of the Sustainability Commission. 2. Motion to elect the Vice-Chairperson of the Sustainability Commission.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Reached out to Commissioner Kartunian to ask if he would put himself forward for Chairperson, and he did not respond. Noted there is an error on the report and the term ends in March rather than April, according to the procedures.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
commissioner_comments.comment: Nominated herself as Chair, as it is her turn, citing similar procedure as the Mayor's election. Also, she would also like to put herself out there.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked if nominations were made all at once or if it's separate.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated it is separate.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Did not have a nomination.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: A second is not required for nominations.

agenda_items.title: B. Selection of Ex-Officio Recruitment Ad Hoc Committee
agenda_items.summary: 1. Motion selecting one voting member and two ex-officio members of the Sustainability Commission to serve as ad hoc student member selection committee to conduct the screening and selection of qualified candidates for interviews.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Staff has advertised the positions on social media and at in-person events. The application closes June 15, with interviews completed by June 25 of this year. The recommendations will be made to the full commission at the July 3 commission meeting, and the commissioners will select the next ex-officios. They need two ex-officios and one voting member to be on the ad hoc committee.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked if staff will be sending communications to different schools, as prior years were mixed.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed they will be sending out information to all the schools through as many outlets as possible with staff member, Austin, helping out.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated her interest in being the person on the committee.

agenda_items.title: A. City of Glendale Sustainability Commission 2025-26 Work Plan

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Provided an overview of the work plan to Commissioner Chakarian. The commission has focus areas, including outreach, building systems, urban ecosystems, mobility, land use, and social and governance systems. The actions planned are to extend the work of the commission.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Identified outreach engagement key projects to be: Student-led engagement, working on Earth Day, ex-officio recruitment, increasing direct public contact, working on collaborative community projects, and meeting with community members at public events.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated the goal for Mobility and Land Use is supporting the Vision Zero Plan, which focuses on reducing accidents, and expanding EV charging infrastructure.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated the goal for Building Systems is to review the Demand Response Programs managed by GWP and prioritize fire resistance on new constructions such as promoting the use of non-combustible materials. Noted they've reached out to Firewise and the U.S. Green Building Council fire teams to present this year.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated the goal for Urban Ecosystems is to support expanding green spaces, prioritizing South Glendale, support Lose the Lawn grass recycling campaign, review green waste diversion programs, improve adherence to SB 1383, reduce dependence on outside water resources, and hope to have Integrated Waste Management team present waste diversion at the August meeting.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated the goal for Social and Government Systems is to provide recommendations to City Council on State Legislation, have legislative review consultants present at the September Commission meeting, and talk about the CAP plan in a minute.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about the reappointments for the Vision Zero Plan.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated that will be brought up to the June Commission meeting.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about other presentations scheduled for the upcoming agenda items.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Not at this time.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about the effectiveness of the cooling centers.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Will try and aim for July for the Commission meeting.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
commissioner_comments.comment: Noted the Commissioner's need to find out about the department that manages cooling centers and who actually runs those.

agenda_items.title: Sustainability Office Updates - Earth Day 2025 and Climate Action Adaptation Plan

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: Held a clothing and art supply swap and repair cafe since February. The clothing and art supply swap was the biggest one to date, with 120 people coming by for a two-hour event. Collected about 590 pounds of clothing and swapped about 490. Had about 16 boxes of art supplies, and collected 16 pounds of batteries for recycling. The repair cafe repaired about 56 items including four bikes.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked for more details about who did the bike repairs.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed it was someone who was available from the Pasadena Repair Cafe.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked if any press releases were issued as the event sounds fabulous.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: How many bikes were repaired?

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: Four

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: Had an Earth Day fair recently on April 26, where it was a rainy morning in the beginning, but then the sun came out and the goats came out and people came out. Had goat yoga and unveiled the city's first-ever electric bus, which is one of the five ready electric buses that will be hitting the streets soon. These buses were supported from grant money, and there will be more coming. Had booths there, a lot of community organizations came out including Food Cycle LA and Food Forward, who are food recovery organizations, as well as Athens Services.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: The Verdugo High School Climate Club was doing an activity, advocating for more students to show up to this event and to get younger generations involved. We had volunteers from my school specifically amongst other GUSD schools, and we were giving out free potting supplies and seed bombs. 40 seed bombs were made and about 140 were taken home, so people really showed up to the booth.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Recognized the amount of work that Nora puts in to planning Earth Day.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: On May 4, there's a Verdugo 10k run, a fundraiser for the Parks and Open Space Foundation. On May 10, it's our teen clothing and prom attire swap. On May 17, the county is putting on a free tire recycling event. This is only available to households, not businesses, but it's going to be at lot 30, which is nearby at Verdugo Park. On May 24, our office is holding a guided nature hike at Catalina Verdugo Trail. It's in collaboration with LA Works, and they will be walking through the trail and going through native plants and the benefits of native plants for our wildlife. On May 31, it's the Let's Go Glendale Open Street event in collaboration with Metro. Community Development Department is hosting that event. June 7th, we're coming back with the clothing swaps. June 14th, Repair Cafe.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about unveiling the electric buses when they are going to be in service, and city-owned solar, asking if they're scheduled.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated the city-owned solar on Perkins has been unveiled, which was live-streamed. For the buses, there was a time crunch so they unveiled it during Earth Day.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about the estimate of when the buses will be used.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: Not too sure, but she knows it is pretty soon.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Suggested a way for the public to welcome the electric bus. To follow up and capture that on video or live stream.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about the tire recycling.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated that all the information is available on Glendale's webpage for slash community, which is a new website that was unveiled in February. Environmental goes to the first study we did. We have recently updated to .org.cap, and that's the Rencon consultant site so that it's all one document. You can view the draft.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Questioned if the website on the slide was .com or .org

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Shared concerns that the original .gov site linked to preliminary documents, so users may have difficulty finding the declaration being commented on, especially since time is running out.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
commissioner_comments.comment: Questioned the specific nature of the problem.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: At .org after scrolling through initial items, hitting "notice of intent" sent her to a prior stage of the document rather than the declaration being considered. So many steps makes commenting confusing, making it more difficult to access the information.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: The note has been issued that the document that there is access, but the website is runconhosting, so they are not linked together.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: There has been one comment that has been received so far.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Warner
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired if the time is expiring and suggested a request for extending the period.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Recognized the concern regarding public comment periods with .org

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: A note has been issued that the document that there is access, but the website is runconhosting, so they are not linked together.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Julian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated it will communicate out the link and correction, but is doubtful that an extension is needed.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Acknowledged the point on not wanting to delay the process, she is simply concerned people can find information as it is now open and not easy.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice-Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked Julian, Do you think we should extend it legally speaking since it was a little difficult for people to comment?

commissioner_comments.speaker: Ex-Officio
commissioner_comments.comment: Staff needs to look to see if there was anything impeding access. It is possible it could get extended. Let the staff look and give a response if reasonable, it will need to have the conservative about making sure that public can access.
